carousel_items: Fentanyl should only be used for people whose pain is not controlled by other opioid medications for at least one week.
For pain, the patch takes 12 hours to start working and all other forms start working in 30 minutes or less.
If using the patch, keep it away from heat sources like heating pads, or else it'll cause the medication to be unsafely released into your skin.
Never stop taking Fentanyl suddenly or else you'll have withdrawal effects. To stop taking it, you'll need to lower your dose slowly.
Never drink alcohol when using Fentanyl.
Just one dose can be harmful or fatal to children, so store and dispose of this medication in a way that children can't get to it.

basics.benefits_moa: Fentanyl is an opioid (narcotic) medicine that works in the brain to lower pain perception.
basics.bottom_line: Fentanyl is an excellent pain reliever, but should only be used by people  who've tried other opioid pain medications and still need more relief.
downsides: Fentanyl isn't for everyone. It's a really strong pain medication and taking too much can be deadly.
It doesn't provide quick pain relief.
Often causes drowsiness and constipation. If using it long-term, use a stool softener.
Like all opioids, don't use when pregnant, since the baby can become dependent on it and have withdrawal symptoms after birth.
Shouldn't be used for people with breathing problems (like asthma and COPD), a slow heart rate, or in the elderly.
If using the patch, you won't be able to get the medicine out of your body quickly in case of an overdose.

downsides_processed.orig: Fentanyl isn't for everyone. It's a really strong pain medication and taking too much can be deadly.
It doesn't provide quick pain relief.
Often causes drowsiness and constipation. If using it long-term, use a stool softener.
Like all opioids, don't use when pregnant, since the baby can become dependent on it and have withdrawal symptoms after birth.
Shouldn't be used for people with breathing problems (like asthma and COPD), a slow heart rate, or in the elderly.
If using the patch, you won't be able to get the medicine out of your body quickly in case of an overdose.

upsides: It's used for people who have tried other opioid medications, but still need stronger pain relief.
Fentanyl is stronger than morphine, works quickly, and doesn't cause as many stomach problems.
It's available in many dosage forms, including a patch, injection, film, nasal spray, and lollipop.
The Fentanyl patch provides long-term pain relief and lowers the number of times you need to take pain medications each day.

upsides_processed.orig: It's used for people who have tried other opioid medications, but still need stronger pain relief.
Fentanyl is stronger than morphine, works quickly, and doesn't cause as many stomach problems.
It's available in many dosage forms, including a patch, injection, film, nasal spray, and lollipop.
The Fentanyl patch provides long-term pain relief and lowers the number of times you need to take pain medications each day.

drugs.name: fentanyl

carousel_items_processed.orig: Fentanyl should only be used for people whose pain is not controlled by other opioid medications for at least one week.
For pain, the patch takes 12 hours to start working and all other forms start working in 30 minutes or less.
If using the patch, keep it away from heat sources like heating pads, or else it'll cause the medication to be unsafely released into your skin.
Never stop taking Fentanyl suddenly or else you'll have withdrawal effects. To stop taking it, you'll need to lower your dose slowly.
Never drink alcohol when using Fentanyl.
Just one dose can be harmful or fatal to children, so store and dispose of this medication in a way that children can't get to it.

risks_warnings.title: Death from lack of oxygen to the body (respiratory depression)
risks_warnings.description: Taking too much Fentanyl can cause irregular or slow breathing that can put you in a coma and can cause death. Fentanyl should be swallowed whole, don't ever crush or chew. If your lips and fingers start turning blue from low oxygen, see a doctor immediately. In the hospital, doctors can give you a medicine that reverses the effects of Fentanyl. Don't take more than your doctor prescribes. Always check with your doctor before starting any new medicines or supplements.
risk_factors: Current use of medicine that affects liver enzyme CYP 3A4
People with not enough thyroid hormones

description_processed.orig: Taking too much Fentanyl can cause irregular or slow breathing that can put you in a coma and can cause death. Fentanyl should be swallowed whole, don't ever crush or chew. If your lips and fingers start turning blue from low oxygen, see a doctor immediately. In the hospital, doctors can give you a medicine that reverses the effects of Fentanyl. Don't take more than your doctor prescribes. Always check with your doctor before starting any new medicines or supplements.

risks_warnings.title: Death from overdose
risks_warnings.description: Even one dose of Fentanyl can be too much for children. Keep the medicine out of reach from children. If you suspect your child has taken Fentanyl, watch for decreased activity, extreme tiredness, and lips and fingers turning blue from low oxygen. Go to a hospital immediately and the doctors can give a medicine that reverses the effects of Fentanyl until the effects wear off.

description_processed.orig: Even one dose of Fentanyl can be too much for children. Keep the medicine out of reach from children. If you suspect your child has taken Fentanyl, watch for decreased activity, extreme tiredness, and lips and fingers turning blue from low oxygen. Go to a hospital immediately and the doctors can give a medicine that reverses the effects of Fentanyl until the effects wear off.

risks_warnings.title: Death in newborn babies from opioid withdrawal (Neonatal opioid withdrawal syndrome)
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know if you have used Fentanyl during pregnancy. Your baby may need special care after birth from experts in this area.

description_processed.orig: Let your doctor know if you have used Fentanyl during pregnancy. Your baby may need special care after birth from experts in this area.

risks_warnings.title: Tolerance, dependence, and addiction
risks_warnings.description: Extended-release and long-acting opioid pain relievers like Fentanyl have a greater risk of addiction, abuse, misuse, overdose, and death. Your body can develop tolerance to Fentanyl, which means that more medicine is needed to treat the same pain. You may become physically dependent on Fentanyl if you have been using it continuously for 2 to 3 weeks or longer, which means that you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly with the help of a doctor. Take only the prescribed dose. People with a history of drug abuse shouldn't take Fentanyl if an alternative medicine is available.
risk_factors: Taking more than the prescribed dose

description_processed.orig: Extended-release and long-acting opioid pain relievers like Fentanyl have a greater risk of addiction, abuse, misuse, overdose, and death. Your body can develop tolerance to Fentanyl, which means that more medicine is needed to treat the same pain. You may become physically dependent on Fentanyl if you have been using it continuously for 2 to 3 weeks or longer, which means that you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly with the help of a doctor. Take only the prescribed dose. People with a history of drug abuse shouldn't take Fentanyl if an alternative medicine is available.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Fentanyl lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Fentanyl lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Fentanyl can lower your blood pressure. You may feel dizzy, lightheaded. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly, such as going from sitting to standing since that is when you will feel the low blood pressure the most. If symptoms continues for more than a few doses, another pain medicine may be better for you.

description_processed.orig: Fentanyl can lower your blood pressure. You may feel dizzy, lightheaded. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly, such as going from sitting to standing since that is when you will feel the low blood pressure the most. If symptoms continues for more than a few doses, another pain medicine may be better for you.

carousel_items: Can cause drowsiness, headache, dizziness, and dry mouth.
For ADHD: Might take up to 2 weeks to see effects.
For high blood pressure: Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
If side effects don't go away, talk to your doctor about alternatives.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

basics.benefits_moa: Clonidine is an alpha-2 agonist. Researchers don't know exactly how it works for ADHD. It works in the brain and lowers the activity of certain stress hormones, but it's not a stimulant like many ADHD medicines.
basics.bottom_line: Clonidine is a non-stimulant option to manage ADHD symptoms and behaviors, but it can lower your blood pressure.
downsides: The pill form can make some people sleepy, dizzy, and have dry mouth.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: The pill form can make some people sleepy, dizzy, and have dry mouth.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: Can be used alone or together with a stimulant-type medicine to treat ADHD.
In studies, it improved attention span and lowered hyperactivity and impulsivity in children and adolescents ages 6 to 17.
Also treats blood pressure and some nervous system and psychiatric conditions.

upsides_processed.orig: Can be used alone or together with a stimulant-type medicine to treat ADHD.
In studies, it improved attention span and lowered hyperactivity and impulsivity in children and adolescents ages 6 to 17.
Also treats blood pressure and some nervous system and psychiatric conditions.

drugs.one_liner: Treats ADHD and lowers blood pressure.
drugs.name: Kapvay

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause drowsiness, headache, dizziness, and dry mouth.
For ADHD: Might take up to 2 weeks to see effects.
For high blood pressure: Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
If side effects don't go away, talk to your doctor about alternatives.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal (rebound hypertension)
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause agitation, headache, tremors, and a sudden rise of blood pressure that can produce complications. Clonidine should be stopped over 2-4 days with the supervision of a doctor. If using with a beta blocker medicine, slowly stop the beta blocker first before stopping Clonidine.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause agitation, headache, tremors, and a sudden rise of blood pressure that can produce complications. Clonidine should be stopped over 2-4 days with the supervision of a doctor. If using with a beta blocker medicine, slowly stop the beta blocker first before stopping Clonidine.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Clonidine impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Clonidine impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Low heart rate (bradycardia)
risks_warnings.description: Clonidine can lower your heart rate too much. Talk to your doctor if you continue to feel dizzy, tired or getting out  of breath doing things you normally can do after using Clonidine for a week.
risk_factors: Using other medicine(s) that slows the heart

description_processed.orig: Clonidine can lower your heart rate too much. Talk to your doctor if you continue to feel dizzy, tired or getting out  of breath doing things you normally can do after using Clonidine for a week.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure (hypotension)
risks_warnings.description: Clonidine can lower your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure in the first week of taking Clonidine. Let your doctor know if you continue to feel dizzy after 1 week of use.

description_processed.orig: Clonidine can lower your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure in the first week of taking Clonidine. Let your doctor know if you continue to feel dizzy after 1 week of use.

carousel_items: Starts working in one hour and works best if you take it regularly.
Can make you dizzy or drowsy, so avoid activities that need you to be fully alert until you know how this medicine affects you.
Take Tramadol with food to avoid an upset stomach.
There are different doses for people who are older or who have liver or kidney disease, so work with your doctor to get the right dose.
Swallow the extended-release tablets whole. They're designed to release the drug slowly and breaking, crushing, or chewing them could cause a serious overdose.

basics.benefits_moa: Tramadol is an atypical opioid pain reliever. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it alters certain brain chemicals to lower pain perception and improve mood.
basics.bottom_line: Tramadol works well to treat severe pain and mood changes. Although it's a little weaker than other opioids, it can still be addictive.
downsides: Some people think it's weaker than other opioid pain medications. It can also cause more upset stomach.

Like other opioid pain relievers, Tramadol has a high risk of addiction, abuse, misuse, overdose, and death. It should only be used for severe pain that requires daily, around-the-clock treatment once alternative treatments haven't worked.
It isn't used for short-term, as-needed pain relief.
It's a controlled substance regulated by the federal government. This means that your use of Tramadol will be tracked to prevent potential prescription abuse.
To get Tramadol in the pharmacy, you'll need to bring in a paper prescription directly from your doctor.

downsides_processed.orig: Some people think it's weaker than other opioid pain medications. It can also cause more upset stomach.

Like other opioid pain relievers, Tramadol has a high risk of addiction, abuse, misuse, overdose, and death. It should only be used for severe pain that requires daily, around-the-clock treatment once alternative treatments haven't worked.
It isn't used for short-term, as-needed pain relief.
It's a controlled substance regulated by the federal government. This means that your use of Tramadol will be tracked to prevent potential prescription abuse.
To get Tramadol in the pharmacy, you'll need to bring in a paper prescription directly from your doctor.

upsides: Relieves moderate to severe pain. It has been shown to work as well as other opioid pain medications.
Compared to typical opioids, it provides unique pain relief and effects on your mood when taken regularly.
Has a lower chance of causing breathing problems compared to other typical opioids.
Doesn't cause as much constipation as other opioid pain medicines. Staying hydrated and taking laxatives can help treat this side effect.

upsides_processed.orig: Relieves moderate to severe pain. It has been shown to work as well as other opioid pain medications.
Compared to typical opioids, it provides unique pain relief and effects on your mood when taken regularly.
Has a lower chance of causing breathing problems compared to other typical opioids.
Doesn't cause as much constipation as other opioid pain medicines. Staying hydrated and taking laxatives can help treat this side effect.

drugs.name: Tramadol

carousel_items_processed.orig: Starts working in one hour and works best if you take it regularly.
Can make you dizzy or drowsy, so avoid activities that need you to be fully alert until you know how this medicine affects you.
Take Tramadol with food to avoid an upset stomach.
There are different doses for people who are older or who have liver or kidney disease, so work with your doctor to get the right dose.
Swallow the extended-release tablets whole. They're designed to release the drug slowly and breaking, crushing, or chewing them could cause a serious overdose.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: Tramadol can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Use with caution.
risk_factors: Using other medicines that can cause seizures

description_processed.orig: Tramadol can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Use with caution.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: People who are suicidal, at risk for suicide, or prone to addiction should not take Tramadol. People who are depressed or taking antidepressants should be monitored closely by a doctor. Watch for worsening depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.
risk_factors: Taking other medications that affect serotonin

description_processed.orig: People who are suicidal, at risk for suicide, or prone to addiction should not take Tramadol. People who are depressed or taking antidepressants should be monitored closely by a doctor. Watch for worsening depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Tramadol with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Go to the hopspital right away if you have symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

description_processed.orig: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Tramadol with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Go to the hopspital right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic (anaphylactoid) reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rare, sudden allergic reactions (including death) can occur, usually after the first dose. Symptoms include difficulty breathing; swelling of the face, tongue, and throat; and itching or hives. This is a medical emergency. People with sensitivity to phenylketones and phenylalanine should NOT take the orally disintegrating tablet (Rybix ODT). This formulation contains phenylalanine in an inactive ingredient.
risk_factors: History of allergic reactions to codeine or other opioid pain relievers

description_processed.orig: Rare, sudden allergic reactions (including death) can occur, usually after the first dose. Symptoms include difficulty breathing; swelling of the face, tongue, and throat; and itching or hives. This is a medical emergency. People with sensitivity to phenylketones and phenylalanine should NOT take the orally disintegrating tablet (Rybix ODT). This formulation contains phenylalanine in an inactive ingredient.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Suddenly stopping Tramadol after long periods of use or after high doses can produce withdrawal symptoms, including anxiety, sweating, insomnia, pain, nausea, shaking chills, tremors, diarrhea, nose and throat irritation, raised body hair (piloerection), and hallucinations. Discontinue slowly with the help of a doctor.

description_processed.orig: Suddenly stopping Tramadol after long periods of use or after high doses can produce withdrawal symptoms, including anxiety, sweating, insomnia, pain, nausea, shaking chills, tremors, diarrhea, nose and throat irritation, raised body hair (piloerection), and hallucinations. Discontinue slowly with the help of a doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Serious side effects and overdose
risks_warnings.description: Serious side effects may include drug abuse, dependence, slowed breathing rate (respiratory depression), and death. Don't take more than your doctor prescribes or take with alcohol, illegal drugs, or other opioid pain relievers.
risk_factors: Taking more than the prescribed dose

description_processed.orig: Serious side effects may include drug abuse, dependence, slowed breathing rate (respiratory depression), and death. Don't take more than your doctor prescribes or take with alcohol, illegal drugs, or other opioid pain relievers.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Tramadol lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

description_processed.orig: Tramadol lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Extended-release form
risks_warnings.description: (1) Extended-release and long-acting opioid pain relievers have a greater risk of addiction, abuse, misuse, overdose, and death. Therefore, they should only be used for severe pain that requires daily, around-the-clock treatment, and only if alternative treatments aren't working. They should not be used for as-needed pain relief. (2) Swallow extended-release tablets whole. They're designed to release the drug slowly, so breaking, crushing, or chewing them could cause a lethal overdose.

description_processed.orig: (1) Extended-release and long-acting opioid pain relievers have a greater risk of addiction, abuse, misuse, overdose, and death. Therefore, they should only be used for severe pain that requires daily, around-the-clock treatment, and only if alternative treatments aren't working. They should not be used for as-needed pain relief. (2) Swallow extended-release tablets whole. They're designed to release the drug slowly, so breaking, crushing, or chewing them could cause a lethal overdose.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: Be as active as you can aqua aerobics submerging body in water above shoulders really helped be
